definition: to coax/to beguile/to win over
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
to cover/to cage/covering/also pr. [long2]
small net
net-like object/to hold sth in place with a net/to wind/to twist/(TCM) channels in the human body

sentences.english: I'm no more fond of selling such a candidate than you are.
sentences.chinese: 我和你一样，并不想为这位候选人去笼络人心。

sentences.english: And the group of research and development of kylin game however draw over the elite inside the industry.
sentences.chinese: 而麒麟游戏的研发团队却笼络了行业内的精英。

sentences.english: How are they going to get their next million users?
sentences.chinese: 他们要去笼络新的一百万用户吗？

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to attract (customers)/to drum up (trade)
to purchase/to bribe
to rely on help from sb
to foster/to support
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to win the support of/to get over to one's side/to keep control of
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to persuade
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to control/to dominate/to monopolize
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
one's former subordinates
to incite disharmony/to instigate
